Name: Anivenge
About the game: Ever since the invention of the car, animals have been at their mercy when crossing the roads. Now, they're ready to get their revenge. In Anivenge, you drop hazards into the road to make cars crash. Each hazard has their own effect - the ramp causes cars to fly into the air, oil makes the spin out, etc. But if the car hits you, you're a road pancake. Anivenge has two play modes. In one you work you way up through levels, each giving you a different challenge such as more lanes, faster cars, narrower gaps, etc. Then there's survival mode - crash as many cars as you can before you get hit, with the cars going faster as time goes by. Early release features a single playable character (a frog), 3 different hazards and over 30 levels. Features definitely coming during Early Release: Many, many more levels, possibly 70 more At least one more hazard (a bomb!) Different playable characters (rabbit, gopher, etc) 2 new 'special' vehicles More background music (so you don't have to listen to the same song every level) Features being considered for development: Remappable controls Controller support New playable characters decided by polls More dramatic crash effects Steam achievements and/or leaderboards Other features as requested by players And of course, any bugs that are reported will be fixed. Anivenge has been thoroughly tested but something always slips through.
